name: European Card Payment Association
goal:
The purpose of the non-profit Association is to represent the interests of its Members in discussions concerning EU regulation impacting the use and / or users of payment cards or similar payment instruments, including measures intended to promote the creation of a single European market for card payments (SEPA for Cards).

Membership of the Association includes :

- card schemes whose brand is currently used only within the European Economic Area (EEA) and which are commonly known as "domestic card schemes" such as :

Bancontact Company (BE), BankAxept (Norway), Borica (BG), Cartes Bancaires "CB" (FR), Bancomat (I),EURO 6000 (ES), LINK (UK), Nets /Dankort (DK), ServiRed (ES), SIBS MB (PT), and Sistema 4B (ES)

- organisations which manage essential functions such as type approval only within the European Economic Area (EEA) such as the UK Finance, the Dutch Payments Association and the PAN Nordic Card Association
interests: Economic and Financial Affairs, Information Society
euInitiatives:
The European card Payment Association :

- monitors, evaluates and responds to relevant legislation proposed in the EEA,
- maintains a dialogue on behalf of its Members with organisations such as the European Commission, the European Parliament, the European Central Bank, the Euro Retail Payments Board, the European Banking Authority, EMVCo, and PCISSC and other National, European or International bodies
which are active in relevant in areas of interest of its Members, including but not limited to legislation, security and standardisation concerning cards, card transactions and similar payment instruments
